name: interrupt
content:
interrupt verb
(STOP SPEAKING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ I or T ] to stop a person from speaking for a short period by something you say or do: She tried to explain what had happened but he kept interrupting her. I wish you'd stop interrupting.
More examplesFewer examplesPlease feel free to interrupt me if you don't understand anything.Please go on with what you're doing and don't let us interrupt you.The senator thoroughly squelched the journalist who tried to interrupt him during his speech.He's very impatient and always interrupts me mid-sentence.She rudely interrupted my speech.
